00029 double OLPomdp::doSteps(Vector& totalRewards, int steps, bool learn) {
00030 
00031 
00032     Vector action(simulator->getActionDim());
00033     Vector rewards(simulator->getRewardDim());
00034     Vector reinforcement(simulator->getRewardDim());
00035     
00036     totalRewards.clear();
00037 
00038 
00039     for (int s = 0; s < steps; s++) {
00040         // Must do next line before calling getAction() since
00041         // getAction will accumulate log action gradients into the
00042         // trace directly for efficiency.
00043         if (learn && obs.getSteps()>0) controller->discountTrace();
00044         obs.setSteps(obs.getSteps()+1);
00045         simulator->getObservation(obs);
00046 
00047         controller->getAction(obs, action, learn);
00048 
00049         if (simulator->doAction(action) != 0) break; 
00050 
00051         // If the rewards are for the curret state, we get the reward
00052         // for the new state here.  Otherwise, if the reward is state,
00053         // action, we get the reward for the transition just
00054         // completed.  Finally, if it's state, action, next state,
00055         // then we should really move getRewards one line earlier
00056         // (above doAction).
00057         // This is a problem I haven't quite figure out how to resolve yet.
00058         // In algorithms like LSTDQ that assume this latter case,
00059         // it manually remembers the old reward and stores the
00060         // reward it's about to get passed.
00061 
00062 
00063         simulator->getReward(rewards);
00064         totalRewards += rewards;
00065         if (learn) {
00066             reinforcement.assign(rewards - baseline);
00067             // [daa] Moved the check for 0 reward to the controller level
00068             //controller->instantStep(reinforcement, obs);
00069             controller->instantStep(rewards);
00070         }
00071 
00072 
00073 
00074     }
00075 
00076     totalRewards /= steps;
00077     return inner_prod(totalRewards, scalar_vector<double>(simulator->getRewardDim(), 1.0))/simulator->getRewardDim();
00078 
00079 }
